claim: Import and retaliatory tariffs caused large declines in imports and exports.
source_quote: Import and retaliatory tariffs caused large declines in imports and exports.

claim: Prices of imports targeted by tariffs did not fall, implying complete pass-through to duty-inclusive prices.
source_quote: Prices of imports targeted by tariffs did not fall, implying complete pass-through of tariffs to duty-inclusive prices.

claim: Full incidence of the tariff falls on domestic consumers.
source_quote: the full incidence of the tariff falls on domestic consumers

claim: Tariff incidence remains almost entirely on U.S. firms and consumers in 2019 data.
source_quote: U.S. tariffs continue to be almost entirely borne by U.S. firms and consumers.

claim: Tariffs were almost fully passed through to total prices paid by importers.
source_quote: the tariffs were almost fully passed through to total prices paid by importers

claim: 2018 washer tariffs raised washer prices by about 12 percent.
source_quote: the price of washers rose by nearly 12 percent

claim: In exports, the WLS specification with exposure and rigidity controls (2016-2017 vs 2018-2019) yields a negative dem_share coefficient (p=0.0126).
Export pretrend interactions are negative and significant in 2014 and 2017 in the 2012-2017 event study.
County-level exposure to tariff-affected industries is weakly negatively correlated with Democratic vote share (corr = -0.06575).
Panel fixed-effects interaction of dem_share with post period is not significant for imports or exports.
